column2: The log GDP per capita, adjusted for PPP to a constant 2017 international dollar, is derived from the World Development Indicators by the World Bank. The GDP time series is extended from 2021 to 2022 using country-specific growth forecasts adjusted for population growth.

Social support (0-1) is the national average of the binary responses (0=no, 1=yes) to the Gallup World Poll (GWP) question “If you were in trouble, do you have relatives or friends you can count on to help you whenever you need them, or not?”
Healthy life expectancy at birth time series is based on WHO data with 2005-2019 observations, and interpolation and extrapolation are used to match the report's sample period (2005-2022).
Freedom to make life choices (0-1) is the national average of binary responses to the GWP question “Are you satisfied or dissatisfied with your freedom to choose what you do with your life?”
Generosity is the residual of regressing the national average of GWP responses to the donation question “Have you donated money to a charity in the past month?” on log GDP per capita.

Perceptions of corruption (0-1) are calculated by taking the average of binary responses to two questions on the prevalence of corruption in government and businesses. If data on government corruption are unavailable, the perception of business corruption is used as a proxy.

Positive affect is the average of laughter, enjoyment, and interest experienced during the previous day, with interest being a new addition for the World Happiness Report 2022. The affect questions ask if individuals experienced certain feelings during a lot of the day yesterday.
Negative affect is defined as the average of previous-day effects measures for worry, sadness, and anger.
